root: ^When they put a weapon in your hands, you meld with it, becoming what you hold inside and out.
^Faster than the human eye, more lethal than anything before.

faster: ^Ah, I see. Guns. Ah yes, guns. Fuck guns really.
iDid: ^I did. I did. But I've just decided against letting it be modern day. Fuck you, this is a western now.
^AW HELL YEAH. IM A COOOOWBOY BABY.
cowboy: ^So, like all good westerns, this is the story of a showdown.
^People know they can sleep safer tonight.
scatter: ^Doors close, windows slam shut, children are pulled inside by their parents. You cut a distinct shadow on that old dusty road, right through the center of town. You saddle right up to the bank, and with one good kick of your boot, smash the door right in.
^Demand all the money they got, now.
^Stay silent, and stare down the teller.
demand: ^The teller knows exactly who you are, and trembles as they back towards the safe, shakingly taking out the key, but they hesitate for a moment before they unlock the vault door.
^Point your gun and remind them why they're so scared.
^Smile casually, and keep your threats light but firm.
gun: ^Well damn okay. That poor guy. Chill man.
^He lets out a squeak and clambers to get the safe open.
^"Well now, I think that's just about enough there, pardner."
^A slow, clear drawl echoes in the small space behind you. You turn to see...ah hell.
^"Nice to see ya, lieutenant." Mac as you turn to face him.
^Get outta here while you still can, old bud.
getOut: ^Mac lets out a laugh, but there's no humor there. "Oh I don't think I will. Heard about your exploits lieutenant. Going around, killin', threatenin', takin' people for all they got. Figured someone, eventually would haveta stop you."
youThink: ^"Well why not? Weren't we friends, compatriots back in the day? I know the war changed ya, Lieutenant. But this is a road I just can't let you go down my friend. Be doin’ us all a disservice."
^And how exactly *will* you stop me, Mac?
how: ^"I don't want any trouble, old friend. So we'll settle this the old fashioned way. You, me, high noon on main street. Bring just your gun."
^Or I could shoot you now, and get this over with.
showdown: ^Mac smiles at you, and you remember why you used to get on so well with him. All those years ago.
^But the war's a long time gone now, and you've gone down very separate paths.
^You watch Mac turn and head off.
^Leave the bank for now, you've been issued a challenge after all.
leave: ^You go and bully the saloon keeper into giving you a bed for the night. The next day, just before noon, you head on down to main street, and there's Mac, standing in the sun, easy as could be.
^"Gonna give you one more chance, Lieutenant. You could just come on down to the Sheriff's with me. Get some justice paid out, no one has to die."
^Oh I think this kind of justice suits me fine.
justice: ^You stare each other down as the clock ticks forward, and you know what's coming. Every second draws you closer and closer to noon. You know Mac's an honorable man. He won't shoot until the clock strikes, a fair duel. You also remember every second of your friendship with this man. How good of a shot he is, how much better of a man than you. The kindness he's shown you over the years.
fuckFair: ^You shoot seconds before the clock strikes 12.
^The sound is deafening, and you're a good shot yourself.
^Mac doubles over, stricken, surprised. Even now he thought you'd be honorable. But Mac had always underestimated you.
^He crumples in a heap. You hear a wail from somewhere. You turn and stride right back into the bank.
^The Teller doesn't hesitate at all this time.
safer: ^You've crafted a name for yourself as the one just man left in the west. If there was one thing you learned in the war, it's that everyone is capable of horror. You've taken it upon yourself to end those who've lost their way. Whether by turning them away from their path, or by ending it for good.
^You're riding by the bank when you hear a major commotion inside. A scream, followed by some gruff yelling. Something horrible's obviously going down.
getInThere: ^You run past the door and are shocked at what you find. The man with the gun pointing at the teller isn't surprising, an unfortunately common occurrence in the lawless west.
^No, it's who's holding the gun that gets your attention?
mac: ^He turns on his heel, the gun now leveled at you, slowly going wide eyed.
^"Now, now you just stop right there, lieutenant, y-you don't come any closer!"
^You haven't seen Mac since the war ended, poor guy took a bullet to leg. Those balls rip right through a man, you can see how one leg limps. The man's shaking.
^But Mac was a man of honor before, this isn't like him at all.
^"I, I don't wanna have ta' shoot you, lieutenant."
whatHappened: ^"Desperate times call for desperate measures lieutenant. Can't work with a bum leg, but I can still hold a gun."
^The longer this goes on, the tighter Mac's grip gets, and it's becoming worrying. Would he shoot?
canHelp: ^"No, I don't think you can..." and he turns back to the teller, gun ready, looking more desperate by the second.
shootHim: ^Mac looks more surprised than anything, gasping and arching. He gets one good look at you as he crumples to the ground.
^And just like that, it's all over.
staySilent: ^You don't need to explain, the teller knows exactly who you are, and is slowly terrified. Only briefly hesitating before moving towards the back, shaking like a leaf. Then he hesitates again.
^Point your gun and remind them why they're so scared.
^Smile casually, and keep your threats light but firm.
immediatelyPointGun: ^"Hey woah now captain! That's enough, no need for violence." he puts his hands up and takes a deep breath.
^"Come on, you need help, someone's gotta help you."
smileCasually: ^The teller shudders at your words, even if the tone is almost friendly.
^"Well now, I think that's just about enough there, pardner."
^A slow, clear drawl echoes in the small space behind you. You turn to see...ah hell.
^"Nice to see ya, lieutenant." Mac says as you turn to face him.
^Get outta here while you still can, old bud.
dontWannaShoot: ^"Then put the gun down, captain. Or I'm gonna have to stop you."
^And how exactly *will* you stop me, Mac?
putItDown: ^You take a deep breath and lower the gun to the floor, and Mac walks over, holstering his gun and drawing you into a hug.
^"We'll fix it captain. We'll make this all right again. I promise."
howWillYouStopMe: ^"I don't want any trouble, old friend. So we'll settle this the old fashioned way. You, me, high noon on main street. Bring just your gun."
^Or I could shoot you now, and get this over with.
couldShootYouNow: ^You level your gun at him again, but all you get in return is a slow smirk.
turnAround: ^Did you really think that was going to work? Come on man, what the fuck.
^You don't get half way through your sentence before Mac shoots you dead. He wasn't that far away. Your reign of terror comes to an end because you couldn't fucking stop yourself.
^I'm not even making this an ending, this is just dumb.
waitAndDuelFairly: ^You wait, more tense than you've ever been. Even during the war, there was nothing like this.
^The clock strikes out, you draw, you shoot.

^You feel the impact, let out a gasp, and drop your gun. Right in the chest. You've got seconds. You watch Mac put his gun down. You managed to get off a shot, he's grasping his shoulder, you think he's yelling but you can't hear.
^He starts over to you, but you never see him make it.
liftYourGunIntoTheSky: ^You wait until the clock strikes, and point your gun in the sky.
^You feel nothing. Mac missed on purpose. He walks over to you and draws you into a brotherly embrace, a bit of faith in you restored.
^"I won't let them execute ya, Lieutenant. We'll handle this, serve Justice, and start again."
notMyBusiness: ^You try to duck your head and keep moving, pick and choose your battles right?
^And then a patron runs out of the bank, breathing heavy and spots you. "Oh thank god! You gotta help us! He's gonna get someone killed, I swear!"

^Before you can even speak, he pushes you into the doorway and into the bank. You've got a reputation, so once you're halfway there, you just walk the rest of the way. After all, it's hard not to, the other townsfolks are beginning to look at you. You think for a moment that it's not worth the praise. Sometimes you've got to walk away, but then you see exactly who is robbing this bank.
putTheGunDown: ^Mac shakes even more, terrified at the tone of your voice, the anger. He knows you, he's made an enemy of you. It's over for him now.
^"I can't, Captain...I can't, I need the money, Captain."
^He turns back to the teller, fear and desperation in his eyes.
tackleHim: ^You barely think, running forward and tackling him to the ground. In the confusion the gun goes off, and you vaguely feel a pain in your leg. It takes a long moment, but the pain settles in as the adrenaline calms down, and you realize what's happened.
^and you look up at him. It will be okay. You'll work together now. You'll fix this.
^Of course you're still bleeding out so actually this is a rather y’know, open ending. Cheers.
crushing: ^A hammer larger than your head, wielded with the strength of ten men, a true warrior, you are.
areYouOk: ^Oh yeah I'm fine I'm just losing the tone of this game very quickly. Tone her I've never even heard of her.

^Either way, you're sitting on the edge of a battlefield. Blood, everywhere, especially all over you. That's probably not sanitary. It's okay though, because you do this all the damn time. Like all the time, and you haven't died yet, so you're doing better than the guy whose head you just crushed. So now what?
commander: ^Your Commander, Commander Jones Hurley, a big woman with a bigger axe. You're in good company here. She's ruthless as hell, and stronger than you. A lot of people aren't big fans of her, because she just doesn't give a singular shit about anything but getting the job done, and you know, that'll make ya some enemies.
alwaysLikedHer: ^Of course you did, and she knows it. You've always been good friends, the Commander and you, and everyone knows it. So no one likes you either. But that's okay, because they're all too afraid of the two of you to do anything about it.
until: ^One day, the others come to you, looking a little fearful, and a little hopeful. It's late, like really late, and they almost surprise you. They mill in front of you while you try to ask what's going on, but then one speaks up. The leader-ish. A scraggly looking guy, beady eyed and, well you know he looks shady. Like think of every shady looking piece of shit in every movie ever who's out for himself.

^And he tells you. They think it's about time Commander Hurley got knocked off her horse. She's running this place into the ground. Running them all so ragged that they can't stand it anymore. Most of them didn't sign up for this shit.
^They want you, to take over. To mutiny. If mutiny is still the right word for this type of thing.
^Well, I did always want that job...
absolutelyNot: ^"Oh we figured as much." Kraglin sounds slightly disappointed, but unsurprised.
^Commander Hurley is a good leader and my friend!
^I may not like her, but I'm no mutineer.
goodLeader: ^"Fucking suck up." And he pulls out his sword, as do most of them, ready to kill you first, as one of the biggest people in their way. You're strong, stronger than any one of them. But it's about 10 to one, and all of you are highly trained warriors.
^I pull out my hammer and start breaking skulls, I'm no coward.
^Retreat while I can to find Hurley, no shame in that.
hammer: ^You manage to fight them off for a long while, and many of them lie dead on the ground, crushed to smithereens, before Kraglin finally gets one lucky shot. Straight through your chest with his sword. You'd always teased him for that little sword, but you're not laughing now.
^You fall to the ground, sliding down off the sword and into the dirt.
sheSucks: ^And everyone knows that. You're one of the well known warriors in this army? Force? Band of murdering compatriots? Who knows. No matter what you're called, they look up to you. That's well and good. You work under your commander for years, with really no issue.
wantThatJob: ^Actually no, fuck you and your mutiny.
letsMutiny: ^"We knew you'd make the right choice, Commander. If we act now, we'll get the element of surprise!"
youreRight: ^You all head over as quietly as possible to Hurley's tent, luckily none of the other mercs really wake, and Hurley's snoring away. But you have to be really, really careful. She's a light sleeper.
sneakIn: ^You very carefully sneak into the tent, quiet as you can be, but she does stir. Grumbling as she begins to wake.
killHer: ^You move forward, going to stab her, and her eyes go wide, rolling out of the way at the last second.

^It takes a minute, and half the tent fabric falls down on top of you, struggling to get control of the knife that now you've both grabbed onto. It's a lot of scuffling and then a sharp pain in your chest.
imNoMutineer: ^"You always were too loyal for your own good." Kraglin snarls, and gestures for the others to pull out their swords. Axes, hammers, 10 different types of weapons from ten different highly trained warriors, all pointed at you. You're stronger than any one of them, but all together...
^I pull out my hammer and start breaking skulls, I'm no coward.
^Retreat while I can to find Hurley, no shame in that.
retreat: ^Good choice. You manage to back out of the tent and run for it, Kraglin's men chasing you the whole way. Which makes plenty of noise, rousing the very few other people in camp, including Hurley herself.

^Hurley shakes her head and rises out of her tent, glaring at you all before she sees you being chased. Always quick to the point, she gives a battlecry and grabs her axe, charging straight at the group.
^The other soldiers take a moment but begin to grab their things as well.
helpHurley: ^You turn around, finally grabbing your hammer, and swing at the very first person behind you.
^In one fell swoop, you crush his chest with your hammer, sending him flying off, crumpling to a heap across camp.
^From there, it's almost too easy. Between you and Hurley, all the mutineers go down, and soon you're standing a field of corpses for the second damn time today.
^Hurley looks at you and demands an explanation.
^Probably best not to tell her they came to you for help.
probablyBest: ^She looks at you and grins at what you tell her. "Always knew you were the trustworthy sort, Lieutenant. Good work! Keep it up and you may just have your own group to lead one day. Under my supervision of course."

^That's probably the closest you'll ever get to a commendation from Hurley. You honestly think she trusts you now, and within a few months you're leading a smaller group of men from the team, training them and taking on smaller missions.
^It's a good feeling. To be trusted. To be looked up to by your men.
holdOn: ^You explain to Kraglin and the others that you can seed further dissent over time, isolate her from the other men, but make her trust you so you can make her less likely to realize what you're doing.

^Kraglin puts his trust in your plan and over the next few months you do so. The other mercs aren't hard to subtly sway, they're not all that intelligent, and again, they're mercenaries, not a particularly loyal kind of job, you know?

^Hurley still trusts you, and after a month or so, you realize the time is right when you're alone on a clearing battlefield. She's got her back to you, leaning on her axe. You have a signal with Kraglin who's among the other men to begin the attack, getting rid of the last few loyal men and Hurley in one fell swoop, and now, while everyone is tired, seems like the best time to do so.
stabHer: ^She doesn't even get a chance to turn around, gasping and crumpling to the ground. One good stab! One shot, one kill.
^No I will not change that reference. Fuck you.

^Anyway, you give the signal and Kraglin and the others get rid of the rest of the loyal men. Once the others realize what's happening, they fall in line easily enough, and by nightfall, you're the new Commander of the band.
^Oh some people leave and there are some smaller issues over the coming weeks, but overall, success! Underhanded, traitorous success! Huzzah!
sendKraglin: ^You wait for a few seconds as Kraglin tries to quietly get into Hurley's tent and finish her, but she bolts awake as he gets near and from that cracking sound, breaks his neck.
^Then she crawls out of the tent, axe wielding and ready.
^Pretend you were on her side and fight the other mutineers.
fightHer: ^You take out your hammer and stand ready as Hurley turns to you and raises her axe, glaring, snarling, disgusted that you were a part of this. She runs at you, axe arching above her head.
high: ^Your hammer clashes with her axe, ringing out across the clearing, locking you into a battle of strength and will. You know, like every game with a duel mechanic when you have to press like X over and over and over and hope you win?
^No, that's not how this game works.
pressX: ^You eventually get the upper hand, sliding your hammer down against the handle of her axe and crushing downwards, effectively disarming her and knocking her down. You don't however, kill her.
^She glares up at you. "How dare you! Traitor!"
finishHer: ^You don't speak, just bring your hammer down and end it. Damn okay.
^So, she dead now. Um, I guess that's it? Everyone else just kind of scatters. Guess you're on your own man.
stayStill: ^She looks around, but the tent is super dark, and since the eye is drawn to movement, and you're not moving, she scans right over you and grumbles, and goes back to sleep. The things you learn reading Ranger's Apprentice.

^Once she's snoring again, you're able to sneak up and slit her throat. Sneaking back out the deed is done. Come morning they find her, and no one is able to discern who did it. The other mutineers don't tell.
^So the chain of command falls to you.
watchAndWait: ^You take a few steps back and watch as Hurley and a few other soldier's try and end the mutineers. But there are only around ten of them, and Hurley is a sight to behold on the battlefield, axing through them all like butter. It's wonderful to watch.
^Then she turns to you, and realizes your weapon isn't drawn.

^Now Hurley is an intelligent woman, but an angry one who takes no threats to her command. You might have said no to the mutineers, but you didn't exactly help her either. It might have seemed smart not to choose a side, but as she cuts through Kraglin like he's a toy, she then comes right after you.
low: ^You take out your hammer and swing for the legs as she goes to chop through your head, crushing them entirely. Woof that's uh...well that's honestly not something I want to type out in detail wow, those war hammers really do some damage huh?
^She dies soon after, cursing you the whole time, you "dishonorable swine" and some other expletives that are just very, very colorful.

^The merc band doesn't survive long after either. Without a strong leader in charge, and since you obviously betrayed the last one at the last second, none of your remaining men (and women...look the english language is patriarchal, that's not my fault.) stick around very long.
^So you begin your own career, working for yourself, and honestly, it suits you just fine.
giveSignal: ^You call out to Kraglin, unfortunately, he's not a very subtle kind of guy, and before you can even turn back around to attack Hurley, he calls out, very loudly, "LETS KILL THEM BOYS!"
^Which of course puts Hurley on alert, and as you turn and grab your knife she turns and sees what you're doing, backing away and grabbing her axe. "Oh, you traitorous pig!"
^You don't have time to get your hammer out, trying to put the knife away as she comes at you and fucking cleaves you in half.
^No, that's not how this game works.
notHowThisWorks: ^Well, okay it's not, it's a visual novel, but you don't have to be so rude about it.
^You lose the fake little battle contest thing, and Hurley cleaves you in two.
helpHerUp: ^You walk over while she's spitting insults at you and offer your hand, watching her blink in confusion.
^"What are you doing?" I mean it's a valid question, but after a second she just kind of huffs. "You know what, never mind. Get in line, I'll decide what to do with you later."
^And so, you live to fight another day. But the future is ever unclear.
